content.title: Erhebung über die Einkommen und Lebensbedingungen (SILC) 2007 bis 2011: Ergebnisse zur Armut in der Schweiz – 580'000 Personen waren 2011 von Einkommensarmut betroffen
content.lead: (BFS) - Gemäss den neuesten Ergebnissen des Bundesamtes für Statistik (BFS) waren 2011 in der Schweiz rund 580000 Personen von Einkommensarmut betroffen. Davon waren rund 130000 Personen erwerbstätig. Alleinerziehende, Personen mit geringer Bildung und Personen in Haushalten ohne Arbeitsmarktteilnahme sind besonders oft armutsbetroffen. Seit 2007 hat die Armutsquote um fast 2 Prozentpunkte abgenommen.
content.text: Diese Medienmitteilung und weitere Informationen zum Thema finden Sie auf der Website des BFS (siehe Link unten)

content.title: Enquête sur les revenus et les conditions de vie (SILC) de 2007 à 2011: résultats sur la pauvreté en Suisse – La pauvreté monétaire touchait 580'000 personnes en 2011
content.lead: (OFS) - Selon les derniers résultats de l'Office fédéral de la statistique (OFS), la pauvreté monétaire touchait quelque 580'000 personnes en 2011 en Suisse. Parmi celles-ci, 130'000 environ exerçaient une activité rémunérée. Les personnes élevant seules leurs enfants, les personnes peu formées et celles vivant dans des ménages sans activité rémunérée sont les plus touchées. Le taux de pauvreté a reculé de près de 2 points depuis 2007.
content.text: Vous trouverez ce communiqué de presse et d'autres informations sur ce thème sur le site web de l'OFS (voir le lien ci-dessous)

content.title: Rilevazione sui redditi e le condizioni di vita (SILC) 2007-2011: risultati sulla povertà in Svizzera – Nel 2011, 580'000 persone erano interessate dalla povertà reddituale
content.lead: (UST) - Secondo i più recenti risultati dell'Ufficio federale di statistica (UST), nel 2011 in Svizzera circa 580'000 persone erano interessate dalla povertà reddituale, laddove circa 130'000 di esse risultavano occupate. Sono più spesso colpiti dalla povertà i genitori soli con figli a carico, le persone con un basso livello di formazione e le persone appartenenti ad economie domestiche che non partecipano al mercato del lavoro. Dal 2007 il tasso di povertà è sceso di quasi 2 punti percentuali.

content.title: Statistics on Income and Living Conditions Survey (SILC) from 2007 to 2011: results on poverty in Switzerland – 580,000 people were affected by income poverty in 2011
content.lead: Neuchâtel, 13.08.2013 (FSO) - According to the latest findings of the Federal Statistical Office (FSO), around 580,000 people in Switzerland were affected by income poverty in 2011. 130,000 of these were employed. Lone parents, persons with a low level of education and persons in households that do not participate in the employment market are most often affected by poverty. Since 2007, the poverty rate has decreased by almost 2 percentage points.
content.text:
The risk of poverty is lower in Switzerland than in the EU
In order to compare the situation in Switzerland with other countries, the internationally accepted at-risk-of-poverty rate is used. Switzerland's rate of 15% puts it below the EU average of 16.9%. In terms of material provision which is measured using the severe material deprivation rate, Switzerland even recorded the lowest rate of all countries with 1.0% (EU average: 8.8%).
